result.execSummary:
The defendant Roberto I Campos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders the balance of the cash bond ($57.00) be applied to the court costs.

1)  Court will allow expungement upon successful completion of probation, pay all court costs and get into no other trouble.
2)  Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

timeConds.notes: Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the cash bond on file be applied to the court costs.  PAID IN FULL.
Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt:
11:51 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat.  Court goes over the agreement, defendant will plea to counts 1 & 3 on 2016CF22 and count 1 on 2015CM266. 

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1, striking the on or near enhancer and finds the defendant guilty on count 3 and orders counts 2 & 4 be dismissed and read-in.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2015CM266 as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2016CF22 (Count 1)

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-60 days county jail.  Sentence is to commence within 60 days.  Huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
-AODA assessment and any follow-up.
-Court costs.
-Court will allow expungement upon successful completion of probation, pay all court costs and get into no other trouble.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

2016CF22 (Count 3)

-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-DNA sample.

2015CM266

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.


Court adjourned at 12:06 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 28, 2016 at 11:30 am.

10:25 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by the Court - defendant called the COC office earlier.  Statement by Atty Privat - requests to be put on for next week.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on November 28, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.  Mandatory appearance.

Court adjourned at 10:26 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.

2:14 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court goes over agreement from the last hearing, defendant will plea to counts 1 & 3 on 2016CF22, and count 1 on 2015CM266 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Statement by the Court.  Statement by Atty Privat.  Court is not going to accept this offer.  Atty Privat is to talk with the defendant to see if he wants to enter a plea or not.

Court adjourned at 2:19 p.m.

Corut reconvenes at 2:35 p.m.  Apeparances remain the same.

Statement by Atty Privat - requests an adjournment.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on November 21, 2016 at 10:00 a.m.

Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Statement by the court. Court sets for plea & sentencing on October 18, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.

Status hearing at 04-05-2016 11:30 am

2:28 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - is representing the defendant on both cases and defendant will waive the preliminary hearing today.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 5, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:31 p.m.

2:25 p.m.  Defendant present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not waive the time limits.  Court will set for Preliminary hearing on February 23, 2016 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:30 p.m.

Court re-calls case at 2:39 p.m.  Same appearances.  Court goes over right to counsel.
